009
010package imagingbook.common.image;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013
014import ij.ImageStack;
015import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
016import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.sRgbColorSpace;
018
019/**
020 * This class defines a "color stack" as a subtype of {@link PixelPack} with
021 * exactly 3 components (slices), representing a color image in a specific color
022 * space (default is {@link sRgbColorSpace}). It allows simple conversion to
023 * other color spaces (see {@link #convertFromSrgbTo(ColorSpace)}). All
024 * conversions are 'destructive', i.e., the affected color stack is modified.
025 * Pixel values are typically in [0,1], depending on the associated color space.
026 * A {@link ColorPack} may be created from an existing {@link ColorProcessor}
027 * whose pixels are assumed to be in sRGB color space (see
028 * {@link #ColorPack(ColorProcessor)}). To be converted back to a
029 * {@link ColorProcessor}, the {@link ColorPack} must be in sRGB color space
030 * (see {@link #convertToSrgb()}).
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/09/10
034 */
035public class ColorPack extends PixelPack {
036
037        // the current color space of this color stack
038        private ColorSpace colorspace = null;
039
040        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
041
042        /**
043         * Constructor.
044         * @param cp a color image assumed to be in sRGB
045         */
046        public ColorPack(ColorProcessor cp) {
047                super(cp, 1.0/255, null);
048                setColorSpace(sRgbColorSpace.getInstance());
049        }
050
051        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
052
053        /**
054         * Returns the 3 color components as an array of {@link FloatProcessor}.
055         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} array
056         */
057        public FloatProcessor[] getProcessors() {
058                FloatProcessor[] processors = new FloatProcessor[3];
059                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
060                        processors[k] = new FloatProcessor(width, height, data[k]);
061                }
062                return processors;
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * Returns the current color space instance of this {@link ColorPack}.
067         * @return the current color space
068         */
069        public ColorSpace getColorspace() {
070                return this.colorspace;
071        }
072
073        private void setColorSpace(ColorSpace colorspace) {
074                this.colorspace = colorspace;
075        }
076
077        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
078
079        /**
080         * Converts the pixel values of this {@link ColorPack} to the specified color space. The color stack must be in sRGB
081         * space. An exceptions is thrown if the color stack is not in sRGB color space. Has no effect if the target color
082         * space already is sRGB.
083         *
084         * @param targetColorspace the new color space
085         */
086        public void convertFromSrgbTo(ColorSpace targetColorspace) {
087                if (!(colorspace instanceof sRgbColorSpace)) {
088                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack must be in sRGB");
089                }
090
091                if (targetColorspace instanceof sRgbColorSpace) {
092                        return; // no effect
093                        // throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert color stack from sRGB to sRGB");
094                }
095
096                final float[] srgb = new float[3];
097
098                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
099                        getPix(i, srgb);
100                        clipTo01(srgb);
101                        float[] c = targetColorspace.fromRGB(srgb);
102                        setPix(i, c);
103                }
104
105                setColorSpace(targetColorspace);
106        }
107
108        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
109
110        /**
111         * Converts this {@link ColorPack} to sRGB space. Has no effect if the color stack is in sRGB color space already.
112         */
113        public void convertToSrgb() {
114                if (colorspace instanceof sRgbColorSpace) {
115                        return;
116                        // throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is in sRGB already");
117                }
118
119                final float[] c = new float[3];
120
121                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
122                        getPix(i, c);
123                        float[] srgb = colorspace.toRGB(c);
124                        setPix(i, srgb);
125                }
126
127                setColorSpace(sRgbColorSpace.getInstance());
128        }
129
130        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
131
132        @Override
133        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor() {
134                if (!(colorspace instanceof sRgbColorSpace)) {
135                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack must be in sRGB to convert to ColorProcessor");
136                }
137                return super.toColorProcessor(255);
138        }
139
140        @Override       // arbitrary scaling is inhibited
141        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor(double scale) {
142                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
143        }
144
145        @Override
146        public ImageStack toImageStack() {
147                ImageStack stack = super.toImageStack();
148                // set slice labels to color component names:
149                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
150                        stack.setSliceLabel(colorspace.getName(k), k + 1);
151                }
152                return stack;
153        }
154
155        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
156
157        private float clipTo01(float val) {
158                if (val < 0) return 0f;
159                if (val > 1) return 1f;
160                return val;
161        }
162
163        private void clipTo01(float[] vals) {
164                for (int i = 0; i < vals.length; i++) {
165                        vals[i] = clipTo01(vals[i]);
166                }
167        }
168
169}
